citations.narrative:
The facility is not following the Program of Vet Care (PVC) for vaccinations. Of the 28 adult dogs, 14 are not up to date on
the rabies vaccination, which is required by the Animal Welfare Act. The current Program of Vet Care prescribes for the
rabies vaccination to be performed at 12 weeks of age and then yearly.
The following dogs are not up to date on the rabies vaccine:
- Female Husky "Bethany" #1058
- Female Husky "Trina" #1055
- Female Husky "Sasha" #1052
- Male Beagle "Indie" #4544
- Male French Mastiff "Jasper" #8501
- Male Husky "Rocco" #3851
- Female Beagle "Bella" #4533
- Female Beagle "Ruby" #5539
- Female French Mastiff "Kelly" #5557
- Female French Mastiff "Kaite" #5552
- Male French Mastiff "Cumins" #5540
- Female Husky "Rohda" #5546
- Female Husky "Ruth" #7300
- Female Husky "Tonya" #2496
Additionally, the facility is overdue for their yearly preventative care screening fecal sampling of the kennel. The PVC
states 10% of the adult dogs and a composite 10% of the litters need to have fecal samples checked per year. The last
stool samples performed for the facility were done on January 3, 2024.
Failure to follow the PVC for vaccinations and preventative care screening can leave the dogs susceptible to diseases or
parasites, which, if contracted, would cause pain, distress, and suffering. It is additionally important for breeding dogs to
be vaccinated because they will pass immunity from vaccines onto their offspring. Correct by administering all of the
vaccines required by the Animal Welfare Act (distemper, parvovirus, and rabies) and perform all preventative care
screening tests, such as fecal sampling, in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and
vaccine manufacturer recommendations. Correct By: March 25, 2025, onward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the Program of Vet Care (PVC) for vaccinations. Of the 28 adult dogs, 14 are not up to date on 
the rabies vaccination, which is required by the Animal Welfare Act. The current Program of Vet Care prescribes for the 
rabies vaccination to be performed at 12 weeks of age and then yearly.  
 
The following dogs are not up to date on the rabies vaccine:  
- Female Husky "Bethany" #1058 
- Female Husky "Trina" #1055 
- Female Husky "Sasha" #1052 
- Male Beagle "Indie" #4544 
- Male French Mastiff "Jasper" #8501 
- Male Husky "Rocco" #3851 
- Female Beagle "Bella" #4533 
- Female Beagle "Ruby" #5539 
- Female French Mastiff "Kelly" #5557 
- Female French Mastiff "Kaite" #5552 
- Male French Mastiff "Cumins" #5540 
- Female Husky "Rohda" #5546 
- Female Husky "Ruth" #7300 
- Female Husky "Tonya" #2496 
 
Additionally, the facility is overdue for their yearly preventative care screening fecal sampling of the kennel. The PVC 
states 10% of the adult dogs and a composite 10% of the litters need to have fecal samples checked per year. The last 
stool samples performed for the facility were done on January 3, 2024.  
 
Failure to follow the PVC for vaccinations and preventative care screening can leave the dogs susceptible to diseases or 
parasites, which, if contracted, would cause pain, distress, and suffering. It is additionally important for breeding dogs to 
be vaccinated because they will pass immunity from vaccines onto their offspring. Correct by administering all of the 
vaccines required by the Animal Welfare Act (distemper, parvovirus, and rabies) and perform all preventative care

screening tests, such as fecal sampling, in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and 
vaccine manufacturer recommendations. Correct By: March 25, 2025, onward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
